column2: Secondary separator<ref name="ss1">For multiple statements on one line</ref>

column1: | semicolon and comma separatedrefThree different kinds of clauses each separates phrases and the units differently:
column2: *# serial-clause using ''go-on-token'' (viz. semicolon): '''begin''' a; b; c '''end''' – units are executed in order.
column3: *# collateral-clause using ''and-also-token'' (viz. ""): '''begin''' a b c '''end''' – order of execution is to be optimised by the compiler.
column4: *# parallel-clause using ''and-also-token'' (viz. ""): '''par begin''' a b c '''end''' – units must be run in parallel threads.

column1: | whitespace separated sometimes period separated optionally separated with commas and semi-colons.
| semicolon separated (but sometimes implicitly inserted on newlines)
|semicolon separated (but sometimes implicitly inserted on newlines)
| comma separated (conjunction) semicolon separated (disjunction) period terminated (clause)
